name: Residence Inn Miami Aventura Mall

reviews.text: Although the hotel and location was nice I was very disappointed in both the housekeeping and service. When I checked into my room there was a pair of used hosiery in one of the vanity drawers (yuck) and the closet was full of the previous guest's shopping bags. I apparently only warranted one washcloth per day and although they were more than happy to take the used bathroom towels they didn't want to leave clean ones to replace them. The housekeeper could only occassionally be bothered to empty the garbage in the kitchenette. The food on the complimentary breakfast was marginal at best. I'm not quite sure how someone ruins oatmeal, but they managed to do it. To top everything off they discharged my hotel keys more than once (I kept them in completely separate places so that if one demagnetized I'd still have one that worked so I know it was them and not me).
reviews.title: Poor housekeeping and service
Perfect
reviews.text: We were very lucky to get a last minute (due to hurricane evacuation) reservation at this lovely property. They are pet friendly, VERY clean, accomodating and professional staff. The rooms were extremely spacious with full sized refrigerator, etc. Perfect location close to both mall and beach. Excellent complimentary breakfast. We intend on going back even if we do not have to evacuate for the next hurricane!! Highly recommend this property!

reviews.title: Great place if you like some space...
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite in November 2003 for 3 nights. The hotel seems to be pretty new and the location is right beside the Aventura Mall. Staff was very friendly, specially the Spanish speaking people.
Spent a few nights at this Residence Inn-Aventura. The 9 story hotel has studio, one and two bedroom suites. As the one bedroom was the same price as a studio, that is what I selected.
reviews.title: Good location, nice staff, great choice

reviews.text: My room on the 6th floor had a 2-burner cooktop, full-size fridge, microwave, dishwsaher, coffee maker, toaster and pots, pans and dishes. There is a desk & chair for working, plus a small dining table with 2 chairs.
reviews.title: Superior Hotel
Far About Average and Such a Quiet Locatiion. A Winner!
reviews.text: Seating was a love-seat sized couch (sofa bed) or an armchair. Also in the living area were an end table, a coffee table and a 25-27 inch TV with LOTS of cable channels. If they don't have the channel you want then you have too much free time!
The bedroom had a queen sized bed, smaller TV, nice sized closet and sink and vanity. The toilet/tub were in a separate room. All in all-a nicely sized room. Very clean as well.
reviews.title: I'm baaack!!!
Stay away
reviews.text: The hotel has free internet in rooms or kiosks off the lobby with a fee of 20 cents per minute. Also, there are a couple laundry rooms but this is where I have a big problem. Laundry is $5.00 per load! (Meaning, 2 dollars each to wash and dry and 1 dollar for detergent!) That's outrageous! I bought a travel sized bottle of Tide at CVS for 2 bucks (and it will do a few loads-you can get it at Target for a buck but I didn't feel like getting on the town shuttle to target!). Did the wash, but hung the clothes up to dry. No laundromats in the phone book. Most of the housing is condos so they would all have laundry facilities.

There is nothing that I could find lacking about this hotel. I am Marriott Platinum Elite and have stayed at many, many Marriott properties. This hotel is great, and has all that I need for a business trip (with a litle fun on the side):
